meanings.sent1: She reluctates before jumping into the pool.
meanings.sent2: He always reluctates when asked to try new foods.
meanings.sent3: The cat reluctates to chase the laser pointer, finding it suspicious.
meanings.sent4: His mind reluctates like a rusty gate, creaking with uncertainty.
meanings.sent5: The student reluctates at the edge of the diving board, fear gripping her heart.

meanings.definition: To be hesitant or unwilling to do something
meanings.sent1: The dog reluctates to go outside in the rain.
meanings.sent2: She reluctates to speak in front of a large audience.
meanings.sent3: The car reluctates to start on cold winter mornings.
meanings.sent4: His heart reluctates to forgive, holding onto past hurts.
meanings.sent5: The flower reluctates to bloom, waiting for the warmth of spring.
